Description: Fragment from rim of pottery mortarium, rim only barely set off from wall. Yellow-beige clay, core light orange, relatively dense. Graffito on inside of lip.
Curator's comments: Williams suggests that the vase was dedicated by Aristophantos who also left several dedicated Chian chalices at Naukratis and at Aegina, though this piece is perhaps rather earlier than the chalices.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 19.1.6)
Villing 2006 / 'Drab Bowls' for Apollo: The Mortaria of Naukratis and Exchange in the Archaic Eastern Mediterranean (no. 15)
Williams 1983 / Sophilos in the British Museum (p. 184 note 54)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (HA.01)
